captions.text: My favorite champion is Katarina, the Sinister Blade.
Stronger cleanup potential than probably anyone in the game.
A lot of people think, like, her ultimate is what she is, but-
Her passive - resetting her cooldowns - means you're able to be extremely mobile and just clean up all these half health champions the minute you get a kill.
She brings a very frustrating laning phase, cause it’s awful to play a champion where her laning phase isn’t good.
It requires you to know the abilities of other champions. Like you have to know them.
You have to know how much damage, and how much “trade” you can do at almost every level. So just a lot of experience with other champions helps a lot when playing Kat.
I tend to play really passive on most champions, but when I’m playing Katarina, like I go for aggressive plays.
Something clicked with her. I was on my alt “Priscent” and I pentakilled, by myself, their entire team.
I honestly stood up from my computer, and stopped playing for the next three days because I was like ‘I’m never going to be able to beat what I just did.’
My name is William Scarra Li, from team Dignitas, and my favorite champion is Katarina.

comments.text:
Plat player with 1500+ katarina games and more than 50 pentas here. Scarra 
said everything, Katarina is one of the hardest champions on the game, she 
is easy to play vs silver/gold but VERY HARD to play at higher elos. And 
this isn't because "the enemy team has cc, they can stop your ultimate" as 
some less skilled players usually say, BUT because of her lane phase. Most 
champions can outfarm her easily, so the key to win a lane is to be 
extremelly agressive, as Scarra said and I absolutelly agree. Poke hard 
with Q, max W to farm better undertower, and keep poking. Buy boots and 
potions for sustain until you see an opportunity to flash, E Q W and 
ignite, ward-jump or minion-jump to safety after you kill your opponent. I 
have tried almost every single build on her. I'm not the "single target" 
kind of player, so most of the times I don't rush DFG. I prefer Zhonyas for 
utility and outplay. Some heavy-counters to katarina if played by a same 
skilled player: Kassadin, Xerath, Riven, Malphite AP, Tristana AP, Syndra 
and late-game Veigar. Some champions I absolutelly crush: Ignite-Lux, 
Diana, Zed (5 pots+armor), Yasuo late game, Akali late game, Talon, Leblanc 
(after nerf). Champions that are usually even with Katarina: Ahri, Ziggs, 
Orianna, Cassiopeia, Zyra, Brand. These last players require the absolute 
timing and aim to instantly kill Katarina, and that's where a simple 
cooldown or mistake can make the difference. Sorry for the long post and 
feel free to give your opinion, there's always things to improve :) 
PS: Sunfire-Katarina works extremely well vs a full ad team, and especially 
vs a Zed! Give it a try!﻿

comments.author: Ryan Yang

comments.text:
+Apa LAMA Surviving in lane as Katarina while maintaining a good amount of 
CS in Diamond is a lot more difficult than it seems. Not only do you have 
to learn the champ, you're going to have to learn all of her matchups to 
the core of the core. Not to mention ward jumping with her takes a little 
time to get used to. Managing Kat's resets is what seperates a good Kat 
player from a great one in my opinion. I myself still haven't completely 
mastered it. Sure you can just face smash the keyboard in teamfights but 
that almost never works out unless the other team is all low or you're 
extremely fed. Usually you want your W to do as much AOE damage as possible 
when you shunpo to multiple players while also timing the CD on everyone's 
CC, meaning I can't just kill someone and then jump to the nearest player 
who happened to be lee sin who can ult me the second I get onto him. It 
really isn't that hard to learn and be good with any champ but becoming 
great with that champ is the real challenge. Lol I got butt hurt a little, 
sorry >.<

know to cc her. Than yeah, fp her and faceroll.

10 mins. Bronze is like 30-40 at 10 mins. Big differance If silver and 
bronze are the same what about gold and silver? Bronze noobs like you are 
always saying "My team sucked im in bronze because of noob team" or "Omg i 
have so many feeders on my team"

comments.text:
+Notinuserightnow
my dear friend there is small difference between divisions, if someone is 
gold and you are bronze that does not mean he is better. When i was 
unranked i played Katarina on mid vs Katarina who was Gold 3 and i beat a 
living crap out of him! I was like 21/4/6 and he was 9/15/8. I am good 
player i was just too lazy to play ranked, that's why i was unranked. When 
i made my 2nd pentakill on ranked with Kata i played with my friend who is 
bronze 4, 2 guys who were silver 5, and one guy who was bronze 1. In enemy 
team there was 1 guy who is Gold 5, one silver 3, one silver 1, and other 2 
players were silver 5.
And i have friend who is unranked because he is too lazy to play ranked but 
he is really good player.
So, yeah, divisions sometimes mean nothing. If someone is bronze that 
doesn't always mean he is noob. Stop bullying those who are lower division 
than you because they may kick your ass. ;)
